title: Human Leukocyte Antigens and Sulfamethoxazole/Cotrimoxazole-Induced Severe Cutaneous Adverse Reactions: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis

annotation.Notes: HLA-A*11:01 was significantly associated with SMX/CTX-induced SCARs (OR, 2.10; 95% CI, 1.11-4.00) compared to tolerant controls.
annotation.Sentence: HLA-A*11:01 is associated with increased risk of severe cutaneous adverse reactions in patients receiving sulfamethoxazole and cotrimoxazole.
Citations: In this systematic review and meta-analysis of 6 studies involving 322 patients with SCARs, significant associations were identified between the HLA-A*11:01, HLA-B*13:01, HLA-B*15:02, HLA-B*38:02, and HLA-C*08:01 genotypes and SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.
Significant associations were found in HLA-A*11:01 (OR, 2.10; 95% CI, 1.11-4.00) compared with tolerant controls.

The results of this systematic review and meta-analysis suggest that multiple HLA alleles (HLA-A*11:01, HLA-B*13:01, HLA-B*15:02, HLA-B*38:02, and HLA-C*08:01) are associated with SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.

annotation.Notes: HLA-B*13:01 showed a strong association with SMX/CTX-induced SCARs (OR, 5.96; 95% CI, 1.58-22.56) compared to tolerant controls.
annotation.Sentence: HLA-B*13:01 is associated with increased risk of severe cutaneous adverse reactions in patients receiving sulfamethoxazole and cotrimoxazole.
Citations: the HLA-B*13:01 allele showed an association with SMX/CTX-induced SJS/TEN and drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms.

Significant associations were found in HLA-A*11:01 (OR, 2.10; 95% CI, 1.11-4.00), HLA-B*13:01 (OR, 5.96; 95% CI, 1.58-22.56), HLA-B*15:02 (OR, 2.23; 95% CI, 1.20-4.14), HLA-B*38:02 (OR, 3.47; 95% CI, 1.42-8.48), and HLA-C*08:01 (OR, 2.63; 95% CI, 1.07-6.44) compared with tolerant controls.

The results of this systematic review and meta-analysis suggest that multiple HLA alleles (HLA-A*11:01, HLA-B*13:01, HLA-B*15:02, HLA-B*38:02, and HLA-C*08:01) are associated with SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.

annotation.Notes: HLA-B*15:02 was significantly associated with SMX/CTX-induced SJS/TEN (OR, 3.01; 95% CI, 1.56-5.80) compared to tolerant controls.
annotation.Sentence: HLA-B*15:02 is associated with increased risk of Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis in patients receiving sulfamethoxazole and cotrimoxazole.
Citations: The HLA-B*15:02 and HLA-B*38:02 genotypes were significantly associated with SMX/CTX-induced Stevens-Johnson syndrome/toxic epidermal necrolysis (SJS/TEN), while...
In the Stevens-Johnson syndrome/toxic epidermal necrolysis subgroup, significant associations were found in HLA-B*15:02 (OR, 3.01; 95% CI, 1.56-5.80)...
...significant associations were found in HLA-B*15:02 (OR, 2.23; 95% CI, 1.20-4.14) compared with tolerant controls.

annotation.Notes: HLA-B*38:02 was significantly associated with SMX/CTX-induced SJS/TEN (OR, 5.13; 95% CI, 1.96-13.47).
annotation.Sentence: HLA-B*38:02 is associated with increased risk of Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis in patients receiving sulfamethoxazole and cotrimoxazole.
Citations: The HLA-B*15:02 and HLA-B*38:02 genotypes were significantly associated with SMX/CTX-induced Stevens-Johnson syndrome/toxic epidermal necrolysis (SJS/TEN)...in the Stevens-Johnson syndrome/toxic epidermal necrolysis subgroup, significant associations were found in HLA-B*15:02 (OR, 3.01; 95% CI, 1.56-5.80) and HLA-B*38:02 (OR, 5.13; 95% CI, 1.96-13.47).

...the HLA-B*38:02 genotype was significantly associated with SMX/CTX-induced Stevens-Johnson syndrome/toxic epidermal necrolysis (SJS/TEN), while the HLA-A*68:01 and HLA-B*39:01 genotypes were associated with SMX/CTX-induced drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms.

...significant associations were found in HLA-B*38:02 (OR, 3.47; 95% CI, 1.42-8.48), and in the drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms subgroup, significant associations were found in HLA-B*13:01 (OR, 23.09; 95% CI, 3.31-161.00)...

annotation.Notes: HLA-C*08:01 was associated with increased risk of SCARs (OR, 2.63; 95% CI, 1.07-6.44) compared to tolerant controls.
annotation.Sentence: HLA-C*08:01 is associated with increased risk of severe cutaneous adverse reactions in patients receiving sulfamethoxazole and cotrimoxazole.
Citations: significant associations were identified between the *HLA-C*08:01* genotypes and SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.
HLA-C*08:01* was associated with increased risk of SCARs (OR, 2.63; 95% CI, 1.07-6.44) compared to tolerant controls.
In the results, we identified significant associations between the *HLA-C*08:01* genotype and SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.

annotation.Notes: HLA-A*68:01 was significantly associated with SMX/CTX-induced DRESS (OR, 12.86; 95% CI, 1.09-151.34) compared to tolerant controls.
annotation.Sentence: HLA-A*68:01 is associated with increased risk of drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms in patients receiving sulfamethoxazole and cotrimoxazole.
annotation.Population Phenotypes or diseases: Disease:Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms
Citations: the *HLA-A*68:01* and *HLA-B*39:01* genotypes were associated with SMX/CTX-induced drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms;

the results of this systematic review and meta-analysis suggest that multiple HLA alleles (*HLA-A*11:01*, *HLA-B*13:01*, *HLA-B*15:02*, *HLA-B*38:02*, and *HLA-C*08:01*) are associated with SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.

annotation.Notes: HLA-B*39:01 was associated with SMX/CTX-induced DRESS (OR, 4.56; 95% CI, 1.31-15.82).
annotation.Sentence: HLA-B*39:01 is associated with increased risk of drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms in patients receiving sulfamethoxazole and cotrimoxazole.
annotation.Population Phenotypes or diseases: Disease:Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms
Citations: the HLA-A*68:01 and HLA-B*39:01 genotypes were associated with SMX/CTX-induced drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms;
In the drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms subgroup, significant associations were found in HLA-A*68:01 (OR, 12.86; 95% CI, 1.09-151.34), HLA-B*39:01 (OR, 4.56; 95% CI, 1.31-15.82).
The results of this systematic review and meta-analysis suggest that multiple HLA alleles (HLA-B*39:01) are associated with SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.

annotation.Notes: Significantly associated with severe cutaneous adverse reactions (SCARs) in the Japanese population.
annotation.Sentence: HLA-A *11:01 is associated with increased likelihood of severe cutaneous adverse reactions when treated with sulfamethoxazole/cotrimoxazole in people of Japanese descent.
Citations: Among Japanese individuals, a significant association has been identified between the HLA-A*11:01 allele and SMX-induced SCARs.
Significant associations were found in HLA-A*11:01 (OR, 2.10; 95% CI, 1.11-4.00) compared with tolerant controls.

The results of this systematic review and meta-analysis suggest that multiple HLA alleles (HLA-A*11:01, HLA-B*13:01, HLA-B*15:02, HLA-B*38:02, and HLA-C*08:01) are associated with SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.

annotation.Notes: Associated with DRESS and SJS in Asian populations.
annotation.Sentence: HLA-C *08:01 is associated with increased likelihood of DRESS when treated with sulfamethoxazole/cotrimoxazole in people of Asian descent.
annotation.Phenotype: drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
Citations: the *HLA-C*08:01* genotype and SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.
significant associations were found in *HLA-C*08:01* (OR, 2.63; 95% CI, 1.07-6.44) compared with tolerant controls.
In Thai populations, significant associations were found in *HLA-C*08:01* (OR, 2.63; 95% CI, 1.07-6.44) compared with tolerant controls.

annotation.Notes: Significantly associated with DRESS in patients tolerant to SMX/CTX.
annotation.Sentence: HLA-A *68:01 is associated with increased likelihood of DRESS when treated with sulfamethoxazole/cotrimoxazole.
annotation.Phenotype: drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms

In the drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms subgroup, significant associations were found in HLA-A*68:01 (OR, 12.86; 95% CI, 1.09-151.34)

The results of this systematic review and meta-analysis suggest that multiple HLA alleles (HLA-A*11:01, HLA-B*13:01, HLA-B*15:02, HLA-B*38:02, and HLA-C*08:01) are associated with SMX/CTX-induced SCARs.

annotation.Notes: Significantly associated with DRESS in several populations.
annotation.Sentence: HLA-B *39:01 is associated with increased likelihood of DRESS when treated with sulfamethoxazole/cotrimoxazole in Asian patients.
annotation.Phenotype: drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
Citations: ... the HLA-A*68:01 and HLA-B*39:01 genotypes were associated with SMX/CTX-induced drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms; the HLA-B*13:01 allele showed an association with SMX/CTX-induced SJS/TEN and drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms.

In the drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms subgroup, significant associations were found in HLA-A*68:01 (OR, 12.86; 95% CI, 1.09-151.34), HLA-B*13:01 (OR, 23.09; 95% CI, 3.31-161.00), HLA-B*39:01 (OR, 4.56; 95% CI, 1.31-15.82).
... the HLA-B*39:01 allele was significantly associated with SMX/CTX-induced DRESS.
